answerText: Borstal Boy[10] This Angry Young Man wrote The Lost Flying Boat and Saturday Night and Sunday Morning in addition to a short story about a borstal athlete who throws a race, "The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner."
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale B + Bellarmine  | 3 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The narrator of this novel decries "RAF raids on Indian villages," and at one point in it, Lavery uncharacteristically praises Presbyterian ministers. For 10 points each. [10] Name this autobiographical novel heralded for its realistic dialogue, the most famous work of the Irish author Brendan Behan.
